questions: Q. 2. Define the following terms : [Board Term-II erm-II,, 2011]  Trade  International Trade  Favourable Balance of Trade  Unfavourable Balance of Trade
answers: Ans.  The exchange of goods among people, states and countries is referred to as trade.  Trade between two countries is called international trade.  When the value of export exceeds the value of imports, it is called a favourable balance of trade.  When the value of imports exceeds the value of exports, it is termed as unfavourable balance of Trade.
